ca.ualberta.team7project.cache

Class CacheOperation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.team7project.cache.CacheOperation

  • public class CacheOperation
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class, Cache programming interface

    MemorySyncWithFS(context) probably would be the first function to call, if you want the threadModelPool in the memory to be loaded.

    this class provides the essential operation for the cache, like searching by uuid in the cache in the memory, or adding threadModel to cache(this is, these threadModels are cached)

    If you worry your memory would lose, like user shutting down the app you could call FSSyncWithMemory(context), which make file to be consistent with memory

    if you want to have direct access to ThreadModelPool in the Main Memory, I have made it to be singleton, which is static and would last in the app as app last,(I guess)

    Author:
    wzhong3

      • loadFile

        public void loadFile(android.content.Context context)
        Make ThreadModelPool in the memory synchronized to the pool in the File System

        Technically, if there is no network connected, this is the first function to call to set the cache up

        Parameters:
        context -

      • saveFile

        public void saveFile(android.content.Context context)
        Make threadModelPool in the file synchronized to the pool in the current memory

        Call this when you want ThreadModelPool in file system to be consistent with the one in memory

        Parameters:
        context -

      • searchByUUID

        public java.util.Collection<ThreadModel> searchByUUID(java.util.UUID uuid,
                                             int mode)
        Search the threadModelPool by UUID and mode

        it has three modes, by_parentid, by_itselfid, and by_topicid. And these mode can be referred by the class name, since they are static return Collection of threadModel

        Parameters:
        uuid -
        mode -
        Returns:

      • saveThread

        public void saveThread(ThreadModel threadModel)
        Insert a single threadModel to the pool in the memory

        don't worry about inserting a duplicated threadModel in the pool. it would check the UUID, and prevent from inserting a duplicated threadModel.

        Parameters:
        threadModel -
